image.altText: a woman stands in a paddock with sand in her hands

props.synopsis: Dusty paddocks, with no grain crop to harvest, and scarce feed for the few animals left, is the reality of many South Australian farmers right now. Four women are redefining resilience and showing what it means to endure tough conditions despite it all.

title.children: Through dust and drought, these women are redefining resilience

image.altText: a woman inside a spaceship

props.synopsis: When Katherine Bennell-Pegg was growing up, she was "mesmerised by the stars" — an enthusiasm that motivated her to pursue astronaut training, and has now secured an honour of a different kind.

title.children: Astronaut and 'trailblazer' named SA's Australian of the Year

image.altText: Kate Hore clenches her fists in celebration

props.synopsis: Melbourne is through to the AFLW preliminary finals as Kate Hore inspires the Demons to a comeback win over Adelaide, while Carlton demolishes a depleted Hawthorn.

title.children: Hore leads Demons to prelim final, Blues blow Hawks away in semi

image.altText: Four types of coloured sand products have been recalled.

props.synopsis: Coloured sand products linked to an asbestos contamination scare have so far been identified at more than 100 sites in South Australia following checks at schools and preschools, the state's education department says.

title.children: Sand linked to asbestos contamination scare found at more than 100 SA education sites

image.altText: Ponds surrounded by boggy farmland.

props.synopsis: A date is set for snorkellers to return Ewens Ponds on South Australia's Limestone Coast, after low water flows caused its closure to the public.

title.children: World-famous diving spot to reopen amid hopes of environmental rejuvenation

image.altText: A Bedford disability support service building.

props.synopsis: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas says he will "definitely not" go to Brazil for COP negotiations, and instead will prioritise saving disability employment provider Bedford.

title.children: SA Premier will prioritise saving Bedford over COP negotiations in Brazil

image.altText: A pile of glass bottles

props.synopsis: Container Deposit Schemes are loved by consumers for getting a little cash back, but wineries say the financial and administrative burden outweighs any environmental boon.

title.children: Small wineries worried about 'onerous' costs of consumer recycling scheme

image.altText: A cricket batter in green plays a shot with a white ball flying away from her

props.synopsis: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning and South Africa batter Laura Wolvaardt sparkle in wins for the Melbourne Stars and Adelaide Strikers.

title.children: Lanning dominates in 100th WBBL game as Stars down Scorchers

image.altText: Australian Federal Police officers raid a home.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide paedophile who posted images online "boasting" about his crimes has been sentenced to at least 14 years in prison. WARNING: This story contains details of sexual abuse that readers may find distressing.

title.children: Adelaide man jailed over 'deeply confronting' child abuse offences

image.altText: five workers in a food warehouse arms outstretched in celebration with large containers of fresh produce

props.synopsis: South Australians have punched well above their weight by donating more than 10 per cent of the target figure for a national 'giveathon' on behalf of a food rescue charity.

title.children: South Australians raise more than $100,000 for OzHarvest through ABC Gives

image.altText: A former politician talking to a crowd of people

props.synopsis: Former South Australian premier Mike Rann has sharply criticised the gas industry and warned that "battalions" of fossil fuel lobbyists will be descending on next year's UN climate summit to influence negotiations.

title.children: 'Swarm' of fossil fuel lobbyists coming to COP31, former SA premier warns

image.altText: A close-up of a hand holding a paintbrush and painting a black circle on a red canvas, with paint pots nearby.

props.synopsis: The truth behind claims of "white hands on black art" will be tested in the SA Supreme Court as one of the country's best-known Aboriginal art groups sues Rupert Murdoch's national masthead for defamation.

title.children: The Australian newspaper sued over 'white hands on black art' reporting

image.altText: security cameras on a pole behind a fence with razor wire on top

props.synopsis: A South Australian court has heard that a correctional services executive was "motivated by financial greed" when he planned a $300,000 prison upgrade rort to fund his retirement.

title.children: 'Ambitious masterplan' led to $300k prison upgrade rort, court hears

image.altText: A blurred parking fine on the windscreen of a white car

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman has won a four-year legal battle against an Adelaide council over a $104 parking fine.

title.children: SA woman wins $104 parking fine challenge after over $50k in legal costs

image.altText: A person's hands hold a book open to pages with photos on them

props.synopsis: More than 20 years after this photo was purportedly taken, it continues to haunt Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.

title.children: The infamous photo former prince Andrew can't outrun

image.altText: Wallabies look disappointed

props.synopsis: The Wallabies's losing run on their spring tour continues, as Ireland records a convincing 46-19 victory on home soil.

title.children: Wallabies hammered as record-breaking Ireland run riot in Dublin

image.altText: Weona Park Stud

props.synopsis: Investigators warned the "situation" at a horse stud in the state's south "is likely to [be] the next welfare issue hitting the news".

title.children: Weeks before public outcry, Biosecurity Tasmania was worried about this horse stud

image.altText: Dark clouds over Brisbane's skyline.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says parts of Queensland and New South Wales will likely see smaller pockets of severe thunderstorm activity on Sunday.

title.children: Heavy rain forecast for parts of Queensland after two rescued from floodwaters

image.altText: Walcha heli rescue

props.synopsis: Nine people are hospitalised after a car crashed into spectators at a rally event in regional NSW on Saturday night.

title.children: Spectators injured when car crashes into crowd at rally at NSW showground

image.altText: young man walks along beach shore wearing a backpack

props.synopsis: For 18-year-old Rivi, knowing what gear to leave behind can be as important as knowing what to take with.

title.children: If you were alone in the wilderness, how would you fare? Take our quiz

image.altText: Burchell Hayes wears a dark jacket and head scarf. He clasps his hands in front of him.

props.synopsis: Five years after Rio Tinto destroyed a 47,000-year-old sacred rock shelter to expand an iron ore mine, an ambitious rebuild is underway drawing inspiration all the way from France.

title.children: French caves inspire re-creation of sacred site in engineering masterclass

image.altText: A woman and a young man grieve, with the woman's hand on the man's face as he cries.

props.synopsis: In just 48 hours, almost 30 people were killed and dozens more injured in the deadliest terrorist assaults on the capitals of both India and Pakistan in more than a decade.

title.children: Why India has had a muted response to the deadly Delhi blast

image.altText: A rescue team wade through flood water on a street in Wales.

props.synopsis: Storm Claudia moves to Wales, swamping the town of Monmouth, where dozens of people are rescued or evacuated from their homes.

title.children: Storm Claudia causes floods across the UK, after killing three in Portugal

image.altText: Rescuers wearing orange jackets search for victims at a landslide site.

props.synopsis: After days of heavy rain in Central Java, a landslide buries a dozen houses in Cibeunying village.

title.children: Deadly Indonesian landslide buries victims up to 8 metres deep in Java village

image.altText: Chris Minns centre, a riot police officer to the right and protestors to the left.

props.synopsis: When 60 neo-Nazis lined outside NSW parliament last week, the premier's response was swift and familiar — steadily tightening the state's protest laws in response to flashpoint events.

title.children: State with some of the most 'restrictive anti-protest laws' doubles down

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: It's the perfect day to confirm just how little you know.

title.children: Rise and shine trivia fiends. It's time to play … HARD!

image.altText: Socceroos player John Aloisi is shirtless and is celebrating joyously, running around the stadium

props.synopsis: Nostalgia can be an intoxicating force, especially when it comes to the 20-year anniversary of the Socceroos' remarkable win over Uruguay on penalties, which remains an Australian cultural touchpoint.

title.children: The ecstasy of the Socceroos' penalty shootout win, 20 years on

image.altText: Woman with a bug catching net.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a new "lucifer" bee with devil-like horns sparks concerns over land clearing regulations in WA's Goldfields region.

title.children: Horned bee discovery raises concerns over land clearing

image.altText: An aerial photos of a coastline, with forests immediately behind the beach and tree covered mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: The Great Koala National Park was announced to protect koalas and forests in northern NSW, but the forestry industry has been left wondering how it can fill a shortfall in supply.

title.children: Chasing the 'middle ground' as forestry industry stumped by koala park

image.altText: Two elderly parents gently guide a young woman in pigtails in a garden

props.synopsis: Darren and Louise Catton have spent years curating a care plan for their daughter Mary, but now face an uncertain future after her NDIS funding was cut dramatically.

title.children: 'We can't retire yet — or ever': NDIS uncertainty up-ending families

image.altText: Teenagers at Surfers Paradise at night in 2013.

props.synopsis: Schoolies celebrations on the Gold Coast will look different this year due to beach erosion in the wake of Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: Gold Coast Schoolies celebrations set to be scaled back and subdued

image.altText: A man holding a joint and a styrofoam cup uses his phone torch to illuminate something at which he and a woman stare intently.

props.synopsis: The Sydney-born movie star discusses how her creative partnership with If I had Legs I'd Kick You director Mary Bronstein has opened the Oscars conversation.

title.children: The movie that pushed Rose Byrne to the edge of motherhood

image.altText: Alex de Minaur looks down during ATP Finals match against Jannik Sinner.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur falls to Jannik Sinner for the 13th straight time, as the Italian advances to the final of the season-ending championship for the third consecutive year.

title.children: De Minaur exits ATP Finals as Sinner reaches decider

image.altText: Two people wearing full-body and head white anti-contamination suits leave a building carrying bags of coloured matter.

props.synopsis: Seventeen schools were shut down on Friday after concerns about asbestos exposure. The reopening of one of the schools has been fast-tracked.

title.children: 'If it was my child': Epidemiologist not worried by asbestos in sand
